title: Ticket #2881: Change default DMTCP checkpoint interval
description:
From Michael Hanke:

Right now the default interval set in the shim script is 1800 sec. Depending on the job and the pool configuration this may be either too short or too long. What do you think about setting the default interval to 0, i.e. no regular snapshotting at all?

This would have the benefit of the least impact on the job performance (no repeated snapshotting, no repeated compression of the snapshot on the execute machine). But at the same time it would preserve the most valuable benefit -- make vanilla job survive a preemption.
remarks:
2012-Mar-12 11:51:44 by adesmet:
For comparison, the default configuration for Condor with the standard universe sets PERIODIC_CHECKPOINT to "$(LastCkpt) > (3 * $(HOUR) + $RANDOM_INTEGER(-30,30,1) * $(MINUTE) )", which is a random time between 2.5 and 3.5 hours. Perhaps the answer is to increase the default checkpoint interval to 3 hours?
